Description: Mosaic glass inlay plaque; translucent light blue; rosette in opaque white; square, slightly convex inlay plaque decorated with six-petalled rosette; the decoration penetrates, i.e. transverses the thickness of the plaque; front side and edges are carefully polished; probably made by the same 'cane technique'; surface of back side uneven; colours fresh.
Bibliographic references: Barag 1985a / Catalogue of Western Asiatic glass in the British Museum, Volume I (53)
Barnett & Davies 1975a / A catalogue of Nimrud ivories with other examples of Ancient Near Eastern Ivories (Suppl.69)
